title: Installation issue: charmpp
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install charmpp build-target=charm++ backend=ucx pmi=pmix +smp +production
...
  >> 3    Error: cannot find /apps/spack/0.16.1/apps/gcc-10.3.0/openmpi-
          3.1.6-kubz/lib!
```

### Information on your system

SLES 15 SP2
Spack version 0.16.1

### Additional information

The issue is that the build script used by the Charm++ build process is hardcoded to use "lib" as the location for the libraries. However, on SLES 15, the default library directory is "lib64". 

Looking at champp's package.py, setting the --basedir build option for Charm++ is not working due to the use of "lib64".
e.g.:

```python
         if "pmi=pmix" in spec:
             options.append("ompipmix")
             options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["openmpi"].prefix])

        if "backend=ucx" in spec:
             options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["ucx"].prefix])
```

I fixed the build issue after changing --basedir to --incdir and --libdir:

```python
         if "pmi=pmix" in spec:
             options.append("ompipmix")
             #options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["openmpi"].prefix])
             options.extend([
                 '--incdir={0}'.format(incdir)
                 for incdir in spec["mpi"].headers.directories
             ])
             options.extend([
                 '--libdir={0}'.format(libdir)
                 for libdir in spec["mpi"].libs.directories
             ])

         if "backend=ucx" in spec:
             #options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["ucx"].prefix])
             ucx_incdir = join_path(spec["ucx"].prefix, "include")
             options.extend(["--incdir=%s" % ucx_incdir])
             options.extend(['--libdir={0}'.format(libdir)
                 for libdir in find_libraries(
                         ["libucs"],
                         root=spec["ucx"].prefix,
                         shared=True, recursive=True
                     ).directories
             ])

```

For info - diff output:
```
diff package.py package.py.new
239c239,247
<             options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["openmpi"].prefix])
---
>             #options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["openmpi"].prefix])
>             options.extend([
>                 '--incdir={0}'.format(incdir)
>                 for incdir in spec["mpi"].headers.directories
>             ])
>             options.extend([
>                 '--libdir={0}'.format(libdir)
>                 for libdir in spec["mpi"].libs.directories
>             ])
254c262,271
<             options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["ucx"].prefix])
---
>             #options.extend(["--basedir=%s" % spec["ucx"].prefix])
>             ucx_incdir = join_path(spec["ucx"].prefix, "include")
>             options.extend(["--incdir=%s" % ucx_incdir])
>             options.extend(['--libdir={0}'.format(libdir)
>                 for libdir in find_libraries(
>                         ["libucs"],
>                         root=spec["ucx"].prefix,
>                         shared=True, recursive=True
>                     ).directories
>             ])
```
